Instruction: Preheat your oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit (175 degrees Celsius) and generously grease a cast iron skillet.

Combine flour, sugar, baking soda, and salt in a medium bowl. Mix in raisins until coated. Create a well in the center; add the egg, buttermilk, and melted margarine. Stir until dry ingredients are incorporated. Transfer dough to a floured surface, knead briefly, then shape into a flat circle and place in the greased pan.
Bake the bread in the preheated oven for 40 to 45 minutes, or until the edges turn golden brown.
